page.title: 08Hewelsfield Village
page.content: In Hewelsfield Church there are two stained glass windows.The church is {over 1,000 years old.}The vicar does not live in Hewelsfield.He lives in St Briavels. The people shop in Brockweir St Briavels,Chepstow,Monmouth,Coleford Lydney and Gloucester.There are {73 {people on the electoral roll.}The children go to school at Wyedean, Brockweir, Tutshill and Bristol.Some of the clever children go to Monmouth High .{316 people}live in Hewelsfield and 20-30 houses are still lived in by the original Hewelsfield families. The church has a {circular grave yard which indicates Saxon times.In the church vestry they make the {Parish {Magazine.}Miss Woodcock the churchwarden said that a square of Free wood is owned by the{Mayor of {Bath and Wells.
